alert.note: Alert for Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 27 at 1:01PM PST until December 28 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST WEDNESDAY ABOVE 5500 FEET... * CHANGES... Shortened the end time to 4 AM Wednesday. * WHAT...Snow above 5500 feet. Additional snow accumulations of up to 2 inches, except up to 6 inches west of Highway 395 above 7,000 feet. A dusting to up to 1 inch is possible below 5500 feet. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties. * WHEN...Until 4 AM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. Strong winds could cause tree damage.
info.instruction: Even light snowfall causes major travel delays, especially during periods of high traffic volume. Be sure to allow extra time to reach your destination. Leave extra space between vehicles since it takes longer to stop on slick roadways. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
